intro: Eriogonum orendense, commonly known as the Orenden's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eriogonum orendense is an important component of its ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various insects.
